NodeObject Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Represents a node of a graphviz dot graph

Member Function Documentation

NodeObject.NodeObject ( $  runner,
$  node_name,
$  dblimit 
)

Construct a new node object

Parameters:
$runner QueryRunner object to run database queries
$node_name the name of this node
$dblimit the limit to use when visiting this node's neighbors in the graph

NodeObject.__toString (  ) 

Output this object as a string. return a graphviz string representation of this node

NodeObject.getNodeAttributes (  ) 

Get the attributes of this node return array structure containing the attribute names as keys and the values of the attributes as values

NodeObject.getNodeId (  ) 

Get the unique numeric id of this node return numeric id of this node

NodeObject.getNodeName (  ) 

Get the name of this node return string name of node

NodeObject.getNodeCategory (  ) 

Get the category of this node return string name of category

NodeObject.getNeighbors (  ) 

Get the neighbors of the node return array structure containing a referencing numeric key as a key and the linking attribute value as the value

NodeObject.setNeighbors ( $  new_neighbors  ) 

Override this node's neighbors and give it new ones

NodeObject.getNodeNeighborDirectionTo ( $  node_id  ) 

Get the link direction of this node to a give neighbor id

Parameters:
$node_id the numeric node id to check the direction of the link on return True if a direct neighbor, False if an indirect neighbor

NodeObject.calculateNodeValueRelationships (  )  [private]

Calculate the value relationships of this node. Value relationships are non-referencing, meaning the content of the attribute is just a value, and is not linked to anything. return key, value array of attribute name, value

NodeObject.calculateNodeId (  )  [private]

Calculate the numeric node id of this node return the numeric node id of this node

NodeObject.calculateNodeColor (  )  [private]

Calculate the node color of this node to show in the graphviz graph return A valid graphviz color string

NodeObject.calculateCategory (  )  [private]

Calculate the category of this node. Every object is in a category, even categories. return category string

NodeObject.calculateNeighbors (  )  [private]

Calculate the neighbors of this node. Nodes have both direct and indirect neighbors, meaning a direct node directly references another object and indiret neighbors mean another node references this node. This function calculate both. Upward neighbors are indirect. return combined indirect and direct neighbors as array of numeric id as key and attribute link name as value

$  return_down

NodeObject.structureDownNeighbors (  )  [private]

NodeObject.getUpNeighbors (  )  [private]

Get the indirect neighbors of this node. Indirect neighbors are nodes referencing this one, not nodes this node is referencing. return query results of attribute keys and values as an array

Store this node id

Escape the node id

Create SQL to count references

Run the query

Fetch the result line

Free the result of the query

If the result line is set and the count is greater the 0

Create SQL to get the upward neighbors

Else, return null

NodeObject.getDownNeighbors (  )  [private]

Get the direct neighbors of this node. Direct neighbors are neighors that this node references return query results of attribute keys and values as an array
